answerText: scanning electron microscopy [or SEM][10] Thin samples for electron microscopy are prepared using one of these devices, which often employ a diamond blade for high precision cuts. Lasers have started to replace physical blades in these devices.
heading: ACF Regionals |2014 | Dartmouth and Notre Dame | 7 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] In this type of microscopy, an image with a topological, 3-dimensional quality is generated. This form of electron microscopy uses backscattered electrons, unlike transmission EM.
